page.title: 06 The Barras
page.content: The Barras as this market is known today began in 1915/16 in the Green Street, Stevenson Street area of Calton by Margaret McIver.The name originates from the selling of goods from carts or barrows. The Barras have now greatly expanded in the Gallowgate area.They are composed of six markets which rent out several hundred stalls, all under cover.All sorts of new goods and food stuffs as well as second-hand things are sold. Almost Â£1,000,000 from S.D.A. was recently spent on improvments through The Barras Enterprise Trust.Their aims are to improve the appearence of the market without changing it's character.This area also contains another famous Glasgow landmark 'The Barrowland Ballroom' built by McIvers in 1934.
